properties.title: Java Pairing-Based Cryptography Library : Docs - Element Functions
properties.author: Angelo De Caro

section.name: Elements
section.p:
Elements of an algebraic structure (groups, rings and fields) are accessible through the
Element
interface that represents a mutable value.

subsection.name: Initializing Elements
subsection.p: You can obtain an instance of the Element interface starting from an algebraic structure, such as a particular finite field or elliptic curve group. Go here to know how.

subsection.name: Assigning Elements
subsection.p: The following methods can be used to assign values to elements. When integers are assigned, they are mapped to algebraic structures canonically if it makes sense (e.g. rings and fields).
subsection.source: /* Sets an element to zero. */ element.setToZero();
/* Sets an element to one. */ element.setToOne();
/* If the element lies in a finite algebraic structure, assigns a uniformly random element to it. */ element.setToRandom();
/* Sets the element to an int. */ element.set(5);
/* Sets the element to a BigInteger. */ element.set(new BigInteger("126785438"));
/* Returns a duplicate of the element. */ Element duplicate = element.duplicate();

subsection.name: Element Exponentiation
subsection.source: /* Raises element to a BigInteger. */ element.pow(BigInteger.valueOf(5));

subsection.name: Comparing Elements
subsection.source: /* Returns true if the element is 1. */ element.isOne();
/* Returns true if the element is 0. */ element.isZero();
/* Returns 0 if a and b are the same, nonzero otherwise. */ a.compareTo(b);
/* Returns true if a and b are the same, false otherwise. */ a.isEqual(b);
/* Returns true if this element is a perfect square (quadratic residue), false otherwise. */ element.isSqr();
/* If this element is zero, returns 0. For a non zero value the behaviour depends on the algebraic structure. */ element.sign();

subsection.name: Import/Export Elements
subsection.source: /* Reads element from the buffer source and returns the number of bytes read. */ element.setFromBytes(bytes);
/* Sets element deterministically from the buffer source.*/ element.setFromHash(bytes, 0, bytes.length);

subsection.name: Make Immutable
subsection.source: /* Returns true if this element is immutable, false otherwise. */ element.isImmutable();
